meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Get ready to skate like it's 1999 all over again, because Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is back and better than ever! The latest remasters of the classic PlayStation era games are a love letter to old-school gamers like me. I mean, who didn't spend hours on end trying to perfect their combos and collecting those pesky S-K-A-T-E letters?

But let's get serious for a second. This isn't just some lazy cash-grab rehashing of the originals. No way! The team at Vicarious Visions has clearly put in the work to make these remasters feel fresh, current, and (dare I say it?) even better than the original games.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What about IGN's review?" Ah, yes, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is indeed a tremendous turnaround from the disappointing Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5. Who knew going backwards could be so much fun?

GameSpot agrees, saying that despite some minor downsides, the game nails the original experience and has plenty of satisfying combos to keep you coming back for more.

Gaming Age gives it a perfect score, calling it one of the best remasters out there - and I'm inclined to agree! It's like stepping into a time machine and reliving those carefree skate sessions with your buddies (or trying to master those impossible 900s alone in your darkened room).

So, what about the critics who didn't quite give it the same glowing review? Well, Worth Playing notes that while it's an excellent remaster, it could've taken a few more risks. And SpazioGames says it's both nostalgic and modern - which is basically just code for "it's perfect" (right?).

Last but not least, Cheat Code Central gives it a whopping 98%, saying it's a perfect remaster that feels exactly like the original games should. Who wouldn't want to relive those iconic skate sessions with Tony Hawk himself?

In conclusion - Hippo Penny approved! Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a must-play for anyone who grew up with these classic games (or just loves a good skateboard). Trust me, you won't regret it.
